body:
Anyone else watching this CS:GO tourney next week?

Thoughts on who will win?
body_tagged:
Anyone else watching this CS:GO tourney next week?

Thoughts on who will win?
title: MLG Columbus

replies.body: Is this question serious? Of course will Fnatic win. The others have 0% chance. Pfff 2ez4fnatic
replies.body_tagged: Is this question serious? Of course will Fnatic win. The others have 0% chance. Pfff 2ez4fnatic

replies.body: LG looks really solid right now and so does Na'vi, so I wouldn't count them out yet. Hopefully EnVyUs actually shows up to this tourney because they haven't been doing to good.
replies.body_tagged: LG looks really solid right now and so does Na'vi, so I wouldn't count them out yet. Hopefully EnVyUs actually shows up to this tourney because they haven't been doing to good.

replies.body: It's EnVyUs, they're not from USA xD
replies.body_tagged: It's EnVyUs, they're not from USA xD

reply_to.body: LG looks really solid right now and so does Na'vi, so I wouldn't count them out yet. Hopefully EnVyUs actually shows up to this tourney because they haven't been doing to good.
reply_to.body_tagged: LG looks really solid right now and so does Na'vi, so I wouldn't count them out yet. Hopefully EnVyUs actually shows up to this tourney because they haven't been doing to good.

replies.body: Hope to see nV bounce back, and it would be cool to see Astralis do well. I'll be watching the final in Spain :)
replies.body_tagged: Hope to see nV bounce back, and it would be cool to see Astralis do well. I'll be watching the final in Spain :)

replies.body:
splyce will win

in all seriousness fnatic will win like always probs
dennis has been so influencial

envyus is shit atm

and astralis are barely a threat

naVi will come 3rd/2nd/4th

As much as I want c9 to win
it wont happen

replies.body:
I'm going to watch, and my predictions are a bit different from others.

I think NIP is going to have a fair chance of winning, think about it. The last tournament, the (I think) IEM one, NIP went 16-14 against fnatic. They aswell won (ESL pro leauge) against fnatic 16-6 on cache, and lost 16-10 on inferno (which is by far fnatics best map). I think Threat have done a lot of impact over the past months with Pyth added, and I think NIP can do quite an upset against them.

Most likely will Lumonisity have some proper pure strats which will play a big role in getting them far in the tournament.

EnVyUs have sucked ass the past tms, sometimes not even getting out of groups, but they may recive motivation for a big comeback for the major, will be fun to see.

VP is shit atm, Pasha had like a 0.5 kdr the past 5 tms or something like that and only really show up 1 per 10 game.


So, NIP or fnatic, imo.

replies.body: Good predictions. I agree that it seems that NiP are making their way back and they are looking quite good after the league, the question is if the real Get_Right will show up because when he does, you don't want to be around him.
replies.body_tagged: Good predictions. I agree that it seems that NiP are making their way back and they are looking quite good after the league, the question is if the real Get_Right will show up because when he does, you don't want to be around him.

replies.body:
Flipsid3 has a decent chance. Sometimes they play like a Tier 3 team, but other times, they play like a Tier 1 team.

I remember they came close to Fnatic recently.

Astralis is probably going to choke in the quarter/semi finals.
